member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.AuthorizationController.Authenticate(LogicSolution.Model.UserModel)
member.summary: Authenticate user

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.#ctor(LogicSolution.Services.ICodeWarsService)
member.summary: All the logic solution in the CodeWars platform

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.DecodeMorseCode(System.String)
member.summary: A function that would take the morse code as input and return a decoded human-readable string

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.FindOddInteger(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Given an array of integers, find the one that appears an odd number of times. There will always be only one integer that appears an odd number of times.
member.returns: the one that appears an odd number of times

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.GetVowelCount(System.String)
member.summary: Return the number (count) of vowels in the given string.The input string will only consist of lower case letters and/or spaces.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.OpenOrSenior(System.Int32[][])
member.summary: To be a senior, a member must be at least 55 years old and have a handicap greater than 7. Handicaps range from -2 to +26.
member.param: List of pairs that consists of an integer for the person's age and an integer for the person's handicap
member.returns: Whether the respective member is to be placed in the senior or open category

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.TwoToOneLongest(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Take 2 strings s1 and s2 including only letters from a to z. Return a new sorted string, containing distinct letters from s1 or s2.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.BreakCamelCase(System.String)
member.summary: The function will break up camel casing, using a space between words. Example: "camelCasing" => "camel Casing"
member.returns: Camel Case Text separated by space

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.Anagrams(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: The function that will find all the anagrams of a word from a list. Example: anagrams('abba', ['aabb', 'abcd', 'bbaa', 'dada']) => ['aabb', 'bbaa']
member.returns: An array of all the anagrams or an empty array if there are none.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.Rot13(System.String)
member.summary: ROT13 is a simple letter substitution cipher that replaces a letter with the letter 13 letters after it in the alphabet.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.IsPangram(System.String)
member.summary: A pangram is a sentence that contains every single letter of the alphabet at least once.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.AlphabetPosition(System.String)
member.summary: This function replaces every letter with its position in the alphabet. If anything in the text isn't a letter, ignore it and don't return it. "a" = 1, "b" = 2, etc.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.FindMissingLetter(System.Char[])
member.summary: This function will find the missing letter in an array of characters. ["a","b","c","d","f"] => "e"
member.returns: The missing letter in the array

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.RGBToHex(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: The function will convert the RGB decimal value to hexadecimal value. Rgb(255, 255, 255) # returns FFFFFF

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.TicTacToeChecker(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32[]})
member.summary: The function will check whether the board's current state is solved.
member.returns: -1 if the board is not yet finished AND no one has won yet (there are empty spots), 1 if "X" won, 2 if "O" won, 0 if it's a cat's game (i.e. a draw).

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.PigLatin(System.String)
member.summary: Move the first letter of each word to the end of it, then add "ay" to the end of the word.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.CodeWarsController.SudokuValidator(System.Int32[][])
member.summary: Accepts a 2D array representing a Sudoku board, and returns whether it is valid or not. Boards containing one or more zeroes are considered to be invalid solution.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.DurationFormatted(System.Int32)
member.summary: The function returns a human-readable format given a value of seconds in integer. Ex: 1 hour, 1 minute, 2 seconds
member.returns: A string in a human-readable format. Ex: 1 hour, 1 minute, 2 seconds

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.SumSmallestNumbers(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The function returns the sum of the two smallest numbers in the array of numbers
member.returns: Returns the sum of the two smallest numbers in the array

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.CountSumNumbers(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Takes an array of numbers and returns a new array, 1st element is count of positive numbers, 2nd element is sum of negative numbers.
member.returns: Returns a new array, 1st element is count of positive numbers, 2nd element is sum of negative numbers.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.MoveZeroes(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Takes an array of numbers as an argument. The function should move all zeroes to the end of the array

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.FindMissingNumber(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Takes an array of numbers as an arugment. The function will find and return the missing number between 1-10.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.IsSortedAndHow(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Takes an array of numbers as an argument. The function should check if the array is sorted and in which order.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.SumMultiples(System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a number as parameter. Sum all positive numbers smaller than the given number divisible by 5 or 3
member.returns: Sum smaller than the given number divisible by 5 or 3

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Controllers.InfluencerCodeController.DivideIntoOdd(System.Int32)
member.summary: If the number is even, divide it into two closest odd numbers where sum is the number, else return the number.

member.name: M:LogicSolution.Services.InfluencerCodeService.PhraseParser(System.String)
member.summary: The function must count characters, words and lines, returning an object with these values.
